com.yaikhom.kdx
Class Checksum

java.lang.Object
  com.yaikhom.kdx.Checksum

public class Checksum
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulates checksum calculation, in accordance with KDX collections requirement.

Author:
gyaikhom

Constructor Summary

          Initialises a checksum calculator, which uses lowercase characters.

          Initialises a checksum calculator, with option to specify character choice for the hexadecimal characters.

public Checksum()
Initialises a checksum calculator, which uses lowercase characters.

Checksum

public Checksum(boolean flag)
Initialises a checksum calculator, with option to specify character choice for the hexadecimal characters.

Parameters:
flag - true if uppercase characters must be used; other wise false.
Method Detail

Does the hexadecimal string use uppercase characters?

Returns:
true if uppercase characters; other wise false.

setUppercaseHexadecimal

Should the hexadecimal string generated using uppercase characters?

getSHA1

public java.lang.String getSHA1(java.lang.String text)
                         throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
Calculates the SHA1 checksum of a string, and returns the value as a hexadecimal string.

Parameters:
text - the string of characters to process.
Returns:
the SHA1 checksum as a hexadecimal string, or null on failure.
Throws:
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

getKDXFilenameHash

public java.lang.String getKDXFilenameHash(java.lang.String fname)
                                    throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                           java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
Calculates the SHA1 checksum of the file path. The supplied filename is first packaged into a KDX filename, relative to the KDX mount point, and its SHA1 checksum is calculated. The resulting hash is used for indexing files inside a collection.

Parameters:
fname - the filename relative to the documents root.
Returns:
the SHA1 checksum as a hexadecimal string.
Throws:
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
See Also:
Collection, Manager.processFile(java.io.File, java.lang.String)
